details.whatItMeans: You continue at school and work toward your Grade 12 (Matric). With support like tutoring or extra classes, you can improve your marks and finish.
details.goodFor: Students who want to keep options open for university or college. A Matric opens many doors.
details.consider: You may need extra help with subjects you find hard. Ask about extra lessons or study groups.

details.whatItMeans: You enrol at a TVET college or skills training programme. You learn by doing, not just reading. After 1-3 years, you get a certificate that employers value.
details.goodFor: People who prefer hands-on work. Good for careers like electrician, hairdresser, IT technician, chef, or mechanic.
details.consider: Find a TVET college near you. Check if they offer the course you want. NSFAS can pay for TVET too.

details.whatItMeans: You stay in school but also explore other options. Maybe you do a short course on weekends, or look into learnerships for after school.
details.goodFor: People who are unsure which path to take. This gives you time to explore while keeping school as a backup.
details.consider: Balance is important. Do not take on too much. Find one extra thing to try, not many.

A.mitigation: Ask for tutoring or extra help. Join a study group.
Focus on your own progress, not others. Every step forward counts.

B.mitigation: Check if there are closer options. Some colleges have hostels.

B.risk: Not sure if the course is right
B.mitigation: Visit the college first. Talk to current students if you can.

C.risk: Feeling overwhelmed by too many things
C.mitigation: Start with one extra activity. You can add more later.
Set a goal for the year. Focus on completing one thing well.

A.action: Talk to a teacher you trust about getting extra help
Make a list of subjects you find hard
Ask about tutoring or study groups at school
Set up a quiet place at home to study
Create a simple study schedule for the week
Find one online resource to help with a hard subject
Talk to family about your goals and what support you need
Start studying for 30 minutes every day
Review: Are you going to school more? How does it feel?
Write down one thing you are proud of this week

B.action: Search for TVET colleges near you
Check the application dates and requirements
Ask someone who works in a field you like about their job
Visit NSFAS website and learn how to apply
Talk to family about TVET as an option
If possible, visit a college or call them
Write down 3 things you hope to learn or do

C.action: List what you are curious about (jobs, skills, courses)
Search for free online courses or short programmes
Talk to a teacher about your options after school
Look up learnerships in fields you like
Create a simple weekly plan: school + exploration time
Ask someone with a job you admire about how they started
Pick one small skill to start learning (online or in person)
Check if your school offers any extra activities or clubs
Review: What did you learn about yourself this week?
Write down your top 2 options to explore more

highAcademicReadiness.en: Your school habits show you can handle the Grade 12 path
highAcademicReadiness.zu: Imikhuba yakho yesikole ibonisa ukuthi ungakwazi ukubhekana nendlela yeBanga 12

lowAcademicReadiness.en: School has been hard, and a different path might suit you better
lowAcademicReadiness.zu: Isikole besinzima, futhi enye indlela ingaba ngcono kuwe

highPracticalPreference.en: You prefer learning by doing, not just from books
highPracticalPreference.zu: Uthanda ukufunda ngokwenza, hhayi emabhukwini kuphela

highConstraints.en: You have challenges like transport or money that affect your choices
highConstraints.zu: Unezinselelo ezinjengokuthutha noma imali ezithinta izinketho zakho

needsSupport.en: You would benefit from extra help and structure

wellbeingConcern.en: You mentioned feeling stressed or sad often, and talking to someone could help
wellbeingConcern.zu: Usho ukuzizwa ucindezelekile noma udangele kaningi, futhi ukukhuluma nomuntu kungasiza

disclaimer.en: This is guidance based on your answers. It is not a final decision or diagnosis. Talk to a teacher, counsellor, parent, or trusted adult about these ideas. They can help you think through your options.
disclaimer.zu: Lesi siqondiso ngokususela ezimpendulweni zakho. Akuyona isinqumo sokugcina noma isimo. Khuluma nothisha, umeluleki, umzali, noma umuntu omdala omethembayo ngalezi mibono. Bangakusiza ucabange ngezinketho zakho.
